title: WCAS HISTORY 492-0-22 Topics in History
topic: New Political History of the U.S.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: After a generation of relative neglect, political history has enjoyed a renaissance in recent decades, profitably combining elements of the social and cultural history that once pushed it aside with its more customary concerns with state power and policy to forge a new political history. Such work looks beyond the formal political process and traditional political class to expand our notion of what politics is and how and where it happens. This course will introduce graduate students to some of the best new political history of the United States to chart the field's evolution, insights, and parameters, and seek its future directions. The course seeks chronological, topical, and theoretical diversity, but focuses on twentieth-century history to provide depth and texture.
